title: Free MBTA bus program extended — for now
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Boston extends free rides on MBTA bus routes 23, 28, and 29 through June using remaining federal funds.
The pilot program, initially funded with $8 million in pandemic relief, was set to end this month.
Future funding sources for the fare-free service are uncertain, as discussions with MBTA and state officials continue.

title: Snow totals: See how much snow your town got
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Franklin County reported the highest snow totals with Leyden receiving 6.5 inches as of Saturday morning.
Essex County also saw significant snowfall with Haverhill recording up to 5 inches by Saturday morning.
The National Weather Service warned of a 'high impact' storm expected from Sunday night into Monday in Massachusetts.

title: She’s running the 2026 Boston Marathon for the 2013 bombing victims
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Marissa LaRosa, 30, from Canton, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon for the victims of the 2013 bombing.
LaRosa was inspired by her coworker Annie, who has run the marathon 24 times, and served as her coach.
The 2026 race holds personal significance for LaRosa as both a tribute and a personal achievement.

title: NH man sentenced for using $1M in COVID relief funds to buy golf course
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Michael Kirouac sentenced to 15 months for using over $1M in COVID relief to buy a golf course.
He redirected $600,000 from Economic Injury Disaster Loans intended for business expenses to buy Angus Lea Golf Course.
Kirouac owned/control four companies and misused EIDL funds, violating the CARES Act's intended use conditions.

title: Man with 25-year record charged in high-end Boston shoplifting spree
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Peter Cutelis, 40, was charged with multiple counts of larceny over $1,200 and drug possession in Boston.
Cutelis has a long criminal history dating back to 2001, including theft and trespassing offenses, says Suffolk DA Kevin Hayden.
Bail set at $2,500; Cutelis held without bail on a New Hampshire fugitive charge, and due in court on March 6.

title: Red Sox will keep Roman Anthony in leadoff spot for 2026 season. What could rest of lineup look like?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Roman Anthony will be the Red Sox leadoff hitter for the 2026 season, manager Alex Cora confirmed.
Anthony showed impressive rookie stats with a .396 on-base percentage and a .931 OPS over 56 games.
Willson Contreras confirmed as cleanup hitter; potential lineup balance features Trevor Story, Jarren Duran, and Wilyer Abreu.

title: Margo Price talks AI, bro-country and meeting Joan Baez at the circus
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Margo Price discusses her admiration for Joan Baez, highlighting Baez's influence on her music and activism.
Price's latest album 'Hard Headed Woman' was nominated for two Grammys for its bold and defiant message.
Price's husband, Jeremy Ivey, has a personal history in Massachusetts, having lived in Athol and Boston.

title: She’s running Boston so children like her daughter get access to healthcare
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Jordan Whitaker, from Deering, NH, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon for Mass. Eye and Ear.
Whitaker runs in gratitude for her daughter’s successful treatment for sinus cysts and sleep apnea at Mass. Eye and Ear.
Funds raised support healthcare access for children needing specialized treatment like Whitaker's daughter received.

title: A.J. Brown’s Eagles teammate doesn’t buy Patriots trade possibility
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: A.J. Brown was mentioned as a Patriots trade candidate, but he and teammate Saquon Barkley dismissed the rumors.
Brown, a Patriots fan, jokingly denied trade interest on the 'Dudes On Dudes' podcast hosted by Edelman and Gronkowski.
ESPN's Adam Schefter noted trade talks are possible, citing Brown's trade requests and connection with coach Mike Vrabel.

title: Here’s what Boston meteorologists are saying about the timing and impacts of the Sunday-Monday nor’easter
author: John Waller
bullets: Forecasters predict a major nor'easter to bring 10-20 inches of snow to eastern Massachusetts and Rhode Island.
The storm is expected to peak from Sunday overnight through midday Monday, with blizzard conditions likely in eastern MA.
Strong winds, power outages, and coastal flooding concerns accompany the storm, impacting travel early next week.
